metadata.synopsis: Player has sided with Nere, but Nere and Thrinn are dead by the time combat is over. In that case, a duergar initiates dialogue and tells you his plans and you get to decide the gnomes' fate.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -625.75, 14.74, 354.754. Talk with Elder Brithvar, convince him you are not a true soul (deception roll) and accept to help him.5. CTRL-Shift-K the Scrying eye.6. Destroy the rubbles holding Nere captive.7. Side with Nere in the mutiny (let Thrinn be killed) but resolve the combat by killing Nere and the rebels.8. Walk back to the main room, dialog should start afterward.

49.speaker: Novice Grumm
49.text: Shit - True Soul Nere's nothing but grub-chow now.

34.speaker: Novice Grumm
34.text: Listen up, bastards - I'm taking charge. Clean your 'nads and pack up.
34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

1.speaker: Novice Grumm
1.text: We're marching to Moonrise. And no death-curse'll be stopping us.
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

41.speaker: Novice Grumm
41.text: Time for the General to recognise us duergar that have been toiling 'round here.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: What about the gnomes? What happens to them?

75.speaker: Novice Grumm
75.text: What - you'd think I'd just toss 'em? They're coming with me. A gift for the General.

53.speaker: Wyll
53.text: Speak up. You can't just let the clan keep them.

7.speaker: Narrator
7.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Symbol on NPC glowsInternalNodeContext: Delete if you are talking to a companion.

67.speaker: Narrator
67.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

2.speaker: Player
2.text: It's a tough journey. The gnomes will be a burden.

60.speaker: Novice Grumm
60.text: Shit - suppose you're right. No use hauling dead weight.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: They will make a fine offering.

80.speaker: Novice Grumm
80.text: Hells yes. The General can't ignore a haul of fresh slaves.

40.speaker: Wyll
40.text: Your heart made of stone? They deserved freedom - and you denied it.

77.speaker: Gale
77.text: Brittle are the foundations upon which the houses of tyrants are built. It seems I judged you to be less brittle than you really are.

22.speaker: Karlach
22.text: Whatever's wrong with you, I hope it's not contagious.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Draw on the power within to enforce your will.

78.speaker: Narrator
78.text: *You focus on the source of the power, but it is quiet and still. It needs to rest.*

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Draw on the power within to enforce your will.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: The gnomes are free. Now walk away, while I'm feeling generous.

90.speaker: Novice Grumm
90.text: Fine. Not looking to piss off a True Soul.

76.speaker: Novice Grumm
76.text: Then show me. And may the Absolute bless the victor!

85.speaker: Novice Grumm
85.text: Yeah? Well I won't give you lip - what the Absolute wants, She gets.

46.speaker: Novice Grumm
46.text: Gnomes - it's your lucky day. Get your squat arses moving, before I take a brand to them.
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

59.speaker: Novice Grumm
59.text: That head of yours must be mixed up. The slaves are for the General. End of.

14.speaker: Novice Grumm
14.text: Slaves could slow us down - if they survive the curse at all.

63.speaker: Novice Grumm
63.text: What the... you messing with my mind? I won't stand for it!

0.speaker: Novice Grumm
0.text: I... I was wrong. I gotta release them.

74.speaker: Narrator
74.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

13.speaker: Narrator
13.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

72.speaker: Narrator
72.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

79.speaker: Narrator
79.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

23.speaker: Narrator
23.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

27.speaker: Narrator
27.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

25.speaker: Gale
25.text: The gnomes should be able to go where they please. They are not the duergar's to keep.

19.speaker: Karlach
19.text: We're not letting that happen, are we?

44.speaker: Player
44.text: This General sounds powerful. Who is he, exactly?

87.speaker: Novice Grumm
87.text: He's the Absolute's Chosen, the way Nere talked. Building an army at Moonrise - best of the best.

91.speaker: Novice Grumm
91.text: Now I'm in charge here, he'll make me a True Soul. Maybe even a Disciple.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: The surface is dangerous. I'm not so sure it's safe to travel.

73.speaker: Novice Grumm
73.text: Absolute let Nere and Thrinn both get capped. She's not offin' me now.

88.speaker: Novice Grumm
88.text: She'll part the curse for me. I got complete faith.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: You mentioned a death-curse. Is the journey so dangerous?

61.speaker: Novice Grumm
61.text: That curse chokes the air from here clear to Moonrise. Not that I'm worried.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: I am freeing these gnomes. Just try and stop me.

52.speaker: Novice Grumm
52.context: NodeContext: za-VAHG. A battle cry leading to combat

42.speaker: Player
42.text: It's time I cut you down once and for all.

66.speaker: Novice Grumm
66.text: Smug words for a walking corpse. Zavagh!
66.context: NodeContext: za-VAHG. A battle cry leading to combat

4.speaker: Novice Grumm
4.text: That death-curse be damned, I'm heading to Moonrise.
